ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Power law with high energy exponential cutoff. XSpec model.

DESC.PARA: A power law with high energy exponential cutoff. The energy range must be positive and non-zero for this integrated model.

If POW_EMIN and POW_EMAX have been defined by the xset command (see 'ahelp set_xsxset'), then the norm becomes the flux in units of 10^-12 ergs/cm2/s over the energy range (POW_EMIN, POW_EMAX) keV, unless POW_EMIN = POW_EMAX, in which case the norm becomes the flux density in micro-Jansky at POW_EMIN keV. In these cases it is important that POW_EMIN and POW_EMAX lie within the energy range on which the model is being evaluated.
This is an additive model component.

ROW.DATA: cutoff energy of exponential cutoff (in keV)

DESC.PARA: This information is taken from the XSpec User's Guide. Version 12.7.1 of the XSpec models is supplied with CIAO 4.4.1.
